title: Brand refresh for a Fitzroy roastery
excerpt: Positioning and visual identity overhaul for a fast-growing cafe collective.
intro: Fitzroy's favourite roastery was scaling to three new sites and needed a brand system bold enough to live on neon signage, packaging, and digital experiences.
background: Brandwell were commissioned to reimagine the roastery's identity ahead of interstate expansion. The existing mark lacked consistency across packaging, retail environments, and ecommerce touchpoints.
approach: Immersive brand discovery workshops with the founding team and front-of-house crew.
Design of a modular identity system with a refreshed logotype, typographic palette, and colour language inspired by Melbourne's laneways.
Packaging prototyping and rollout guidelines covering cups, beans, apparel, and environmental graphics.

testimonial.quote: We gained a flexible brand system that feels premium without losing our neighbourhood roots.
testimonial.name: Nina West

title: Immersive gallery launch experience
excerpt: Spatial storytelling and projection mapping for a Northside opening night.
intro: To unveil a new contemporary gallery, Lumen Assembly transformed the industrial space into a responsive environment for one night only.
background: The client wanted an opening that felt like stepping into the artist's sketchbook. We were asked to connect visitors with the work before it hit the walls.
approach: Mapped the warehouse architecture into a real-time Unreal Engine environment which drove projections and lighting cues.
Crafted sonic and scent design to mirror the artworks' materials, synced via a custom show control system.
Built a participatory sculpture where attendees could manipulate light and texture, feeding captured motion back into the projection canvas.

testimonial.quote: We pushed what a gallery launch could feel like and Lumen Assembly choreographed every sense flawlessly.
testimonial.name: Chloe Lang

title: Digital journey for a sustainable hotel group
excerpt: Booking flow and membership platform built for a carbon-neutral brand.
intro: Luminary partnered with a carbon-neutral hotel group to rebuild the guest journey across search, booking, loyalty, and post-stay communications.
background: Legacy systems created friction for environmentally conscious travellers, from availability filters to carbon offset transparency.
approach: Service blueprinting and UX research to map the end-to-end stay lifecycle.
Design and delivery of a headless booking experience with real-time energy and offset visualisations.
Rollout of a member portal giving guests personalised recommendations and impact tracking dashboards.

testimonial.quote: Guests finally see the positive impact of their stay, and the data proves it.
testimonial.name: Ravi Patel
